dublin_core.dcvalue: Present generation implantable cardioverter defibrillators ICD have become a proven primary therapeutic option in management of symptomatic ventricular arrhythmias and are now being increasingly used for primary prevention The addition of biventricular pacing and atrial defibrillation to these devices has had an impact on the management of several new patient populations The widespread application of these devices requires precise knowledge of their potential benefits and factors that could adversely affect device function
Implantable cardioverter-defibrillators in cardiovascular care: technologic advances and new indications.
